alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 25 at 5:49AM EDT until September 26 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. Localized inundation of 1 to 2 feet above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northeast Suffolk County. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor to locally moderate flooding is expected in the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Some roads and low lying properties including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience minor to locally moderate flooding. The localized moderate flooding is expected mainly along the Peconic Bay in Riverhead. Life-threatening rip currents are likely for all people entering the surf zone. Anyone visiting the beaches should stay out of the surf. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor to locally moderate coastal flooding possible again on Tuesday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.7 FT, MODERATE 6.4 FT, MAJOR 7.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.3 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 25/09 AM 5.6/ 6.1 2.2/ 2.7 2.8/ 3.4 1-2 MINOR 25/09 PM 6.4/ 6.9 3.0/ 3.5 3.2/ 3.7 2 MODERATE 26/10 AM 6.2/ 6.7 2.7/ 3.2 3.2/ 3.7 2 MODERATE 26/10 PM 6.0/ 6.5 2.6/ 3.1 2.7/ 3.2 1-2 MINOR 27/11 AM 5.7/ 6.2 2.2/ 2.7 2.5/ 3.0 1 MINOR 27/11 PM 5.6/ 6.1 2.2/ 2.7 2.3/ 2.8 1 MINOR ORIENT HARBOR AT ORIENT POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.8 FT, MODERATE 5.8 FT, MAJOR 6.8 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.8 FT, MAJOR 3.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 25/07 AM 3.2/ 3.7 0.2/ 0.7 0.6/ 1.1 1 NONE 25/08 PM 4.4/ 4.9 1.4/ 1.9 1.3/ 1.8 1 NONE 26/08 AM 3.7/ 4.2 0.8/ 1.3 1.0/ 1.5 1 NONE 26/09 PM 4.4/ 4.9 1.4/ 1.9 1.3/ 1.8 1 NONE 27/09 AM 3.4/ 3.9 0.4/ 0.9 0.2/ 0.8 1 NONE 27/09 PM 3.4/ 3.9 0.4/ 0.9 0.2/ 0.7 1 NONE FLAX POND AT OLD FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.2 FT, MODERATE 10.2 FT, MAJOR 12.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 4.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 25/08 AM 7.8/ 8.4 0.6/ 1.1 1.3/ 1.8 2 NONE 25/08 PM 8.9/ 9.4 1.6/ 2.0 1.6/ 2.0 3 NONE 26/09 AM 8.6/ 9.1 1.3/ 1.8 1.5/ 2.0 3 NONE 26/09 PM 8.8/ 9.3 1.5/ 2.0 1.2/ 1.7 2 NONE 27/10 AM 8.3/ 8.8 1.0/ 1.5 0.7/ 1.1 1-2 NONE 27/10 PM 8.6/ 9.1 1.3/ 1.8 0.7/ 1.1 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
